010package imagingbook.lib.filters;
011
012import ij.IJ;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ImageAccessor;
015import imagingbook.lib.image.access.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
016import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ScalarAccessor;
017import imagingbook.lib.image.access.VectorAccessor;
018
019/**
020 * This abstract class represents a generic filter that, when applied to 
021 * an {@code ImageProcessor} object performs all pixel-level
022 * iterations automatically.
023 * Concrete sub-classes of this class only need to override a single method:
024 * {@link #filterScalar(ScalarAccessor, int, int)},
025 * which defines how a scalar image component is filtered.
026 * <br>
027 * If the image has multiple components (e.g., an RGB image)
028 * the same scalar filter is applied to all components by default.
029 * To change this behavior, implementing classes should also override
030 * the method {@link #filterVector(ImageAccessor, int, int)}.
031 * <br>
032 * See {@link LinearFilter} for a sample implementation.
033 * 
034 * @author wilbur
035 * @version 2020/12/28
036 * 
037 */
038public abstract class GenericFilter {
039        
040        /* TODO: PASS THE IMAGE PROCESSOR of the original image and
041         * set up width/height, accessors etc., then use apply without processor argument??
042         * Allow source/target to be of different types?
043         */
044        
045        private OutOfBoundsStrategy obs = OutOfBoundsStrategy.NearestBorder;
046        private boolean showProgress = false;
047        
048        protected GenericFilter() {
049        }
050        
051        /**
052         * Sets the out-of-bounds strategy of this {@link GenericFilter}. 
053         * See {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}.
054         * 
055         * @param obs the out-of-bounds strategy
056         */
057        public void setOutOfBoundsStrategy(OutOfBoundsStrategy obs) {
058                this.obs = obs;
059        }
060        
061        /**
062         * Turn on/off if filter progress should be displayed in 
063         * ImageJ's progress bar. Turned off by default.
064         * 
065         * @param showProgress set true to turn on
066         */
067        public void setShowProgress(boolean showProgress) {
068                this.showProgress = showProgress;
069        }
070        
071        /**
072         * Calculates and returns the filter result for a single pixel
073         * at the given position in a scalar-valued image.
074         * Concrete filters must implement at least this method.
075         * 
076         * @param source the {@link ScalarAccessor} representing the source (scalar-valued) image
077         * @param u the horizontal pixel position
078         * @param v the vertical pixel position
079         * @return the resulting (scalar) pixel value for the specified image position
080         */
081        protected abstract float filterScalar(ScalarAccessor source, int u, int v);
082        
083        /**
084         * Calculates and returns the filter result for a single pixel
085         * at the given position in a vector-valued image. 
086         * This also works if the image is scalar-valued, i.e., has only a single
087         * component.
088         * The method implements the default behavior, where the same filter
089         * is applied to all component channels.
090         * Concrete filter classes should override this method if a different
091         * behavior is required.
092         * 
093         * @param source the {@link VectorAccessor} representing the source (RGB) image
094         * @param u the horizontal pixel position
095         * @param v the vertical pixel position
096         * @return the resulting (RGB) pixel value for the specified image position
097         */
098        protected float[] filterVector(ImageAccessor source, int u, int v) {
099                float[] result = new float[source.getDepth()];
100                // DEFAULT: apply the same filter independently to all scalar-valued components:
101                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
102                        result[k] = filterScalar(source.getComponentAccessor(k), u, v);
103                }
104                return result;
105        }
106        
107        /**
108         * Applies this filter to the given image, which is modified
109         * by this operation.
110         * 
111         * @param ip the image this filter is applied to (destructively)
112         */
113        public void applyTo(ImageProcessor ip) {
114                final int w = ip.getWidth();
115                final int h = ip.getHeight();
116                final ImageProcessor ipCopy = ip.duplicate();
117 
118                ImageAccessor iaOrig = ImageAccessor.create(ip, obs, null);
119                ImageAccessor iaCopy = ImageAccessor.create(ipCopy, obs, null);
120                
121                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
122                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
123                                float[] p = filterVector(iaCopy, u, v);
124                                iaOrig.setPix(u, v, p);
125                        }
126                        if (showProgress) IJ.showProgress(v, h);
127                }
128        }
129
130

139//                      for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {

151//                              for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
152//                                      float p = filterPixel(iaCopy, u, v);

154//                              }

156//                      }
157//              }
158//      }
159
160}
